issue.title: [C++] Add filtering option to fs::Selector
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-6615](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6615). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
It would convenient if Selector could support file path filtering, either via a regex or globbing applied to the path.

This is semi required for filtering file in Dataset to properly apply the file format.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6615?focusedCommentId=16933723) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
If the filtering is done on the local end, then it's not very useful to integrate it in selector (all filesystems then have to implement it).

If it helps avoid recursing into uninteresting directories then it can help, but does that happen often?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6615?focusedCommentId=16974180) by Antoine Pitrou (apitrou):*
Can we close this?

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-6615?focusedCommentId=17585779) by @toddfarmer:*
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
